narratives.question_text: Please identify the teaching assistant with whom you interacted most closely _____________________ .
comments: Instructor: Ariana Spawn  Ariana Spawn.
Instructor: Ariana Spawn  Ariana Spawn.
Instructor: Ariana Spawn  Ariana Spawn
Instructor: Ariana Spawn  Ariana

narratives.question_text: What were the strengths and weaknesses of your teaching assistant
comments: Instructor: Ariana Spawn  Very helpful and responsive.
Instructor: Ariana Spawn  Ariana was very helpful. She was willing to assist with assignments. I sought clarity from her on course related issues to which she was always prompt to respond.
Instructor: Ariana Spawn  Ari was extremely responsive on email. She also paid attention during class and helped Taly keep the class activities running smoothly. Nothing but positive things to say!
Instructor: Ariana Spawn  Very well organized and strong communicator!

narratives.question_text: Use the space below to comment on questions 1-14, if you wish
comments: Very valuable. From conversations with fellow classmates, they equally enjoyed the practical nature of the course.

narratives.question_text: What were the best aspects of this course?
comments: The improvization exercises were incredibly useful. The instructors from the drama school who facilitated the exercise were clear and articulate and while I was initially timid in the first round of improv exercises, I quickly built confidence and was able to perform a marketing improv which required on the spot thinking very well. I also enjoyed the open and relaxed class atmosphere that was generated in part by the nature of the course, constantly requiring in-class public speaking exercises. I gleaned and gained tips on how to be a better public speaker from just observing fellow classmates presenting. I enjoyed the 2 speaking events that were organised as part of the course and especially enjoyed the P&G talk on how to make an effective pitch.
Practice with public speaking
- Practice on body language while presenting - Practice on intro and conclusion of presentation - Practice on Q&A sessions while presenting
Activities and practice

narratives.question_text: What aspects of this course need the most improvement?
comments: I was hoping the course would have provided exercises on voice projection and articulation as I feel that as much as confidence in public speaking is critical, it equally requires an accompanying voice structure. Voice exercises on pitch and in flexion would have been very useful for me. The instructor only gave tips/ corrections on this in the last exercises and I was hoping it would have come earlier to give me enough time to address this area while class was still in session.
Practice speaking about more professional topics would be helpful. We did persuasive public speaking, but it was more personal in nature.

Be aware that many other class teach listening and feedback. Might be too much overlap on those topics. Provide students with as many chances as possible to speak in front of the class with specific things to practice.
More resources and assignments

narratives.question_text: Was the relationship between the course lectures and discussion/lab section
comments: No lab, No discussion sessions.

narratives.question_text: Discuss, if you wish, how this course fits into your overall program.  (Please feel free to describe how the course relates to your academic background.)
comments: I am undertaking a management and policy oriented degree programme. The nature of future work places for this programme require constant contact with individuals, presentations of innovations in policy among peers.
Great opportunity to improve my public speaking and communication skills, very relevant to the leadership roles that I want to hold.

narratives.question_text: Why did you take this course?
comments: I took this class because while I often consider myself a good speaker, I sometimes find it challenging to clearly articulate my thoughts to a pubic audience really from an over-conscious I have benefited from this class in this sense but I also hold the view that public speaking is an essential skill that each individual should be equipped with.
To prepare for future presentations as a consultant
To become a more sophisticated public speaker and communicators, and learn tools to teach others whom I work with in the future (e.g. that I supervise) to improve their skills as well.

narratives.question_text: Did the knowledge/skills that you gained from the course meet your expectations ?
comments: Yes. The practicality of the course met my expectations. The in-class public speaking and improv exercises and feedback surpassed my expectations.
I expected to get more practice on professional topics.
Yes
yes

narratives.question_text: If yes, what were the advantages and disadvantages of the group work?
comments: The group work served as an excellent platform for ideation. We brain-stormed together and were able to identify an excellent topic for the class exercise. While I enjoyed the group, I also found some members over-bearing and keen to have their ideas implemented at the expense of the ideas of other group members.
Working in a group was a good experience, though to some extent I wish it wasn't our final assignment.

narratives.question_text: For students who might consider taking this course, what advice would you give them?
comments: Take it, it is a good course.

Public speaking is an essential life skill- for those who consider themselves confident speakers as well as those who consider themselves timid. I highly recommend this class for students who are not native English speakers - just like me.
